definitions.definition: A flight manoeuvre that uses opposing rudder and aileron inputs to move the aircraft sideways without turning it.

subdefinitions.definition: A flight maneuver to rapidly lose speed and/or altitude whilst not altering the aircraft's ground track .

definitions.definition: A flight condition where an aircraft's longitudinal axis is not aligned with its direction of motion relative to the surrounding air .
The angle between an aircraft's longitudinal axis and its direction of motion relative to the surrounding air.

main_definition: ( aviation ) A flight manoeuvre that uses opposing rudder and aileron inputs to move the aircraft sideways without turning it.
secondary_definitions: ( aviation ) A flight condition where an aircraft's longitudinal axis is not aligned with its direction of motion relative to the surrounding air .
( aviation , uncountable , by extension ) The angle between an aircraft's longitudinal axis and its direction of motion relative to the surrounding air.
